nl.tue.screenshotcomparator

Class ScreenshotComparator

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tue.screenshotcomparator.ScreenshotComparator

  • public class ScreenshotComparator
extends Object
    Class used to compare two screenshots.
    Author:
    Lasse Blaauwbroek

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int distanceThreshold
      The threshold for the acceptable color distance of two blocks in the compared screenshots.
      private int pixelsFuzzed
      pixelsFuzzed * pixelsFuzzed is the size of one pixel block.
      private double wrongFraction
      The fraction of blocks that are allowed to exceed the threshold.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      ScreenshotComparator()

      Constructs a new screenshot comparator.

    • Field Detail

      • pixelsFuzzed

        private int pixelsFuzzed
        pixelsFuzzed * pixelsFuzzed is the size of one pixel block. The mean of all colors is taken as the color of the block.

      • distanceThreshold

        private int distanceThreshold
        The threshold for the acceptable color distance of two blocks in the compared screenshots.

      • wrongFraction

        private double wrongFraction
        The fraction of blocks that are allowed to exceed the threshold.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScreenshotComparator

        public ScreenshotComparator()
        Constructs a new comparator with:
        • pixelsFuzzed: 3
        • distanceThreshold: 20
        • wrongFraction: 0.1

      • ScreenshotComparator

        public ScreenshotComparator(int pixelsFuzzed,
                    int distanceThreshold,
                    double wrongFraction)
        Constructs a new screenshot comparator. pixelsFuzzed * pixelsFuzzed is the size of one pixel block. The mean of all colors is taken as the color of the block. The threshold specifies the maximal acceptable color distance of two blocks in the compared screenshots. Parameter wrongFraction specifies the fraction of blocks that are allowed to exceed the threshold.
        Parameters:
        pixelsFuzzed - Block size
        distanceThreshold - Maximal acceptable color distance
        wrongFraction - Fraction of blocks allowed to exceed the distanceThreshold

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(BufferedImage a,
             BufferedImage b)
        Checks if two screenshots are equal. The image is quantified in blocks of the specified pixelsFuzzed size. The color of this block is the mean of the color of the pixels in this block. The screenshots are equal if there are not more than wrongFraction pixel blocks more different than the distanceThreshold specifies.
        Parameters:
        a - First screenshot
        b - Second screenshot
        Returns:
        Whether or not the screenshots are equal
